byline.contributor: Yufan Huang and Vanessa Piao contributed research.

abstract: Chinese court hands noted human rights lawyer Pu Zhiqiang suspended sentence after his conviction on charges that he criticized government; conviction bars Pu, detained since May 2014 for questioning Chinese policies in Xinjiang and Tibet in online posts, from practicing law.
lead_paragraph: The sentence — three years in prison, with a three-year reprieve — means that Mr. Pu will go free, but he will no longer be allowed to practice law.

headline.main: Chinese Rights Lawyer, Pu Zhiqiang, Is Given Suspended Prison Sentence
headline.print_headline: Lawyer Gets Suspended Term in Case Testing Speech Limits in China

snippet: The sentence — three years in prison, with a three-year reprieve — means that Mr. Pu will go free, but he will no longer be allowed to practice law.

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
